availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Henry W. Bippus (Vanderburgh County, Indiana, clerk, private, and quartermaster (U.S.A.))

body.p: Vanderburgh County, Indiana, clerk and soldier. Indiana native. Son of Gotlieb Bippus and Catherine Bippus. Clerk in Vanderburgh County, Indiana, in 1860. Clerk in Vanderburgh County in 1863. Served as a private and quartermaster in the 136th Indiana Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) in 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Indiana, Vanderburgh County, Pigeon, p. 417A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Indiana, Vanderburgh County, Pigeon, p. 638.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Indiana, Vanderburgh County, Evansville, District 6, p. 285B.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Vanderburgh County, IN, June 1863.
_Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served in Organizations From the State of Indiana, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M540, Roll 0006.
_Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Indiana, vol. 7, 1861-1865 (Indianapolis: Samuel M. Douglass, State Printer, 1867, p. 379.
"Henry W. Bippus (1843-1872)," Find A Grave, Memorial 89198711, accessed May 9, 2023, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/89198711.
